main event: On 7 October 1956, an oval-shaped object was sighted in Norwalk, Ohio, appearing smaller than a half dollar, hovering in a one-mile area for 10 to 45 seconds.
interesting points: The object changed colors from green to red to orange., The sighting lasted between 10 to 45 seconds before the object faded from sight., The object was observed at an altitude that was lower than what would be expected for a balloon., No significant astronomical body was in the North Central Ohio area during the sighting., The sighting was recorded on a Project 10073 record card submitted to Project Blue Book.
witness description: a civilian student from Norwalk, Ohio
